question:
Which of the following areas come under the Tundra Biome?
1) Russia
2) North Korea
3) Canada
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Arctic tundra is located in the northern hemisphere. It encircles the north pole and extends till the south to the coniferous forests of the taiga. It occupies the northern fringe of Canada, Alaska, European Russia, Siberia and the island group of Arctic Ocean.
